<rating>1<//rating>< Text>
Awful food and service. I have not eaten out for a long time, and I was craving Asian food, and it was a complete disappointment. Half the items were not available, and one of the dishes arrived ice cold from the refrigerator. The seafood soup had no seafood, just a lot of egg and spinach. They used the cheapest plastic and foam to serve the food, and a couple of the employees were arguing in the kitchen.
All in all, I will much rather stay home, prepare my food fresh and plate it in an excellent porcelain dish than spend money to feel like an animal. Unacceptable, and it cost me $60. I can make crab cakes, buy a steak, salad and a semi decent bottle of wine for that money, and enjoy them while listening to some music. I don't need the hussle of some many restaurants that use the pandemic as an excuse to serve garbage.< /Text>

<UserId.>107659443277339205297<//UserId.>< name>
Warner1929<//name>
<date>1605850241872<//date><rate>3</rate>< Review>
When I arrived to place my order, the hostesses seemed pretty impatient. I ordered the chicken chow mein and the pork bao. They said it would be finished in about 15-20 minutes. When I returned to receive my order, the hostess was screaming back into the kitchen at the chef, and I felt completely awkward being there. I felt it was completely inappropriate. But then my order wasn't ready on top of that. I went back outside to wait for an additional 15 minutes, and turns out my order was sitting on the table next to the cash register just waiting.

When I got home, the chicken chow mein tasted adequate, but the chicken was dry. Pork bao on the other hand was pretty good. But I'm sure it would be better more fresh. It's good food, but I feel their interaction with customers needs improvement. I felt, in my opinion, that I was bothering them to order food, and I mostly felt incredibly uncomfortable being in the midst of their yelling and screaming at one another. I don't know if I'll return. I feel I could find better service elsewhere.</Review>

<rating>5<//rating><Review>Tasty place. The dumplings are good.  Nothing is fancy, but everything is pretty delicious.  We had crab noodles which were ok, but the wonton soup was the highlight for soups as it had a bone broth soup base with white pepper flavoring.  The fried fosh, string beans, and fried rice were decent. < user_id>
102879615751013610513< /user_id>
< user_name>
Jean Lean< /user_name>
<time>1565878274319</time>< rate>
4<//rate>
< Text>
Not sure what's up with the 3 star average for this place. My family has been coming here for a couple years at least and so I never checked the reviews until today. We typically order a few dishes and maybe some dumplings... maybe if you only order dumplings, the experience is just so-so. Also, I think the people who work here are usually pretty nice, so not sure what's up with the bad service experiences. Anyway, here's what we ordered today:
- tofu skin with preserved vegetables and soybeans : the tofu skin is super tender and the flavor was great despite the absence of meat. The preserved veg were fresh and not bitter
- Tai Yang snake gourd- if you haven't had this savory sort of soft squash before, I guess you might be confused. Anyway they did a good job of concentrating the squash's flavor and the added bits of dried shrimp stuff on top added some food umami
- braised pork belly with tofu skin- the flavor on this was bomb! I was surprised by the use of spices which I could swear included cinnamon (I'm guessing it's some 5 spice combo?). The sauce was wonderfully complex and the tofu was soft and soaked up all the sauce. The pork belly could have been a little more tender, but it was still tasty
- cold chicken with sesame sauce - a good deal at $7 for a decent serving of chicken. The sauce is red and looks spicy but it's totally NOT spicy - more sesame-peanuty-slightly-sweet. I liked this dish but didn't think it stood out much.

We didn't have enough room for dumpling type things, but our usual go-to is the pan fried pork buns.

Oh, and as for atmosphere...yes sometimes the tables are a little sticky. Today my leggings totally stuck to the chair after sitting for a while. I guess these things don't bother me because I assume these aspects will help keep the lines short for people like me who don't mind. :)< /Text>

<UserId.>112792156389609391280</UserId.>< user_name>
Miles Madison<//user_name>
< date>
1366814732489</date>
< rate>
2< /rate>
<text>No whites allowed!

Sound racist? It is. I live right by the Culver plaza and have waited for this noodle house to open. To my surprise, both times I went here, no body waited on me.

Despite making obvious gestures and eye contact, the waiters literally looked at me and turned around. During our 25 minute wait two other parties came in, were seated, given drinks, and served. All the while, I was thirsty and starving.

What was the common denominator both times I went here? Full of Asians ordering and speaking in Chinese. Maybe the waiters don't even know English?

Whatever it is, you should not support this diner. No matter if you are African, Caucasian, Asian or Indian, you are created equal within this country.

Someone pass tasty noodle house a memo....< /text><Pictures>None</Pictures><Response>None<//Response><Gmap_id>0x80dcdc45a7f18f5d:0xfcc5fa8b6b94986b<//Gmap_id></record>
</dataset><record>

< userid>

<userid>106309082498732560791</userid>< name>
Tiffany T< /name>
<Date>1502815728961</Date><rate>1< /rate>< text>
Food here isn't bad, but the service is atrocious.  Last time I went here, we specifically asked for spicy beef noodle soup and the waitress brought out the spicy fish and tofu soup.  When we tried to ask about the order, she immediately said no you ordered the fish, I repeated the order back to you.  Look, mistakes happen, but it's kinda hard to mix up beef with fish.  We were put off by the lack of apology, and I guess the other waitress noticed and gave us watermelon juice instead (not full cups).  I really hated the hot and sour taste of the fish soup and refused to eat more. The soup dumplings were over cooked so much that there wasn't a drop of soup inside. The only thing I really liked was the fried pork bun, which is this restaurant's saving grace.  I won't come here again.< /text>

< user>
110052565887300301633<//user>
<user_name>Christina Moseid</user_name><Time>1370562409459</Time><Rating>4< /Rating>< text>
I don't understand the previous post. I was seated with speed and got great service at lunch time. I am not Chinese or Asian.
As for the food, the Vegetarian Duck is the best I have ever had.
The Spicy Soup Noodle with Prawns is spectacular.
I also tried the Shanghai Dumplings (Xaio Long Bao.)
The Dumplings were pretty darn good. Though the best in Orange County can be had at Shanghai 3.6.9. off of Euclid in Anaheim.

All in all if you are near this restaurant go there, it's good authentic Chinese food.
I'll be going back for sure.</text>

< text>
Twice in the past few times I've been there, they have somehow lost my order. Only after 20+ minutes of waiting and me going to the counter to ask what's taking so long, does the manager explain to me that somehow my order never showed up on the screen in the back where they make the orders! Once is forgivable, things happen, technology screws up, but twice? No way! I will now be driving to the 2nd closest location to me from now on. I should note, that in both instances, the manager made it right by refunding my money, but again, only after a 20 minute wait for food and me having to track it down. <user_id>109095711714559464987<//user_id>< Review>
Every combo costs on average $3 more compared to other Carl's Jr. And even the cheap Hamburger that's usually under $2 is over $3 here. Such a terrible business model which will make sure I never go back.

The service and food was decent which is why I didn't give it 1 star.

But realize that you make profit by selling in bigger amounts so you can have customers coming back. If you bleed them on their first visit they will be unsatisfied and never come back.<//Review>

<time>1602478759932< /time>< Text>
I had a great experience today!!  I am pregnant and due tomorrow.  I really wanted to get my hair braided but have been worried about it due to Covid19.  I found Mimi's Beauty Supply, or should I say it found me and couldn't have felt more comfortable and safe.
The owner, Roz, took a stand and not only encouraged but demanded masks due to the fact that I was sitting at the door, getting my hair braided while pregnant.  She was constantly sanitizing handles and basically guarding my safety.  I'm thankful that I found this shop and will be going back.
A customer came in who was very rude and appalled at the fact the she was asked to put a mask on before entering but Roz, the owner, stood her ground and I was impressed.
THANK YOU ROZ, TODAY YOU WERE MY GUARDIAN ANGEL!  And...my hair looks great!<//Text>

<user_id>102160712352447112068<//user_id><Name>Belinda Franco< /Name><time>1569320465979</time><Rating>5</Rating>< Review>
The al pastor tacos are delicious. The meat is thick red big and juicy. They are served w/bits of pineapple which only makes them taste better. They have cucumbers, salsas, red onions, cilantro, limes, anything you might need for your tacos that you can grab. The food truck is on Pacific and they are parked right in front of the restuarant. So you can turn on California St. to drive into the restaurant parking. There is plenty of seating space in the restaurant. Most of the staff is by the food truck. I have only tried al pastor and those tacos get the 5 stars.<//Review>

Just a heads up that you have to wait outside in the heat. It's a rather long no appointment line (I was there from 12-2pm). If you have an appointment then that is a shorter line that moves rather fast. < user_id>
111531841372649547753<//user_id>
<name>Denise Pierce<//name><time>1607157653593<//time>< rate>
3</rate>
< Review>
The DMV is always an experience that you would rather not have to go through, especially during the Covid 19 pandemic. The lines are always crazy no matter the day or time. If you need something done in person, you have no choice but be prepared for about a 3hr or more  window to handle a car reg, transfer, drivers license prob, out of state car reg or drivers license hold issue (items that can be handled online). It's better to come alone bc waiting in the car is uncomfortable. If your disabled, you probably won't be able to manage. The lines usually go to the edge of the building. Everyone in line must wear a mask the whole time as well as inside DMV. DMV personal will check your documents when you get to the sliding door, check your temp, ask you questions about sick people, symptoms, traveling, screening, etc then you will go inside and get a number. You must then return back outside where you stand or sit and wait for your number to be called. If you come after 4pm, you will not be seen by time prob. Security cuts the line at about 415pm to 430pm bc the employees have to finish all people who get a number by 5pm. We got to DMV at 11:30am & got home at 3:20pm. They aren't scheduling appts yet. We went the Weds before Thanksgiving & security sent the line home before 4pm. Sanitizer everywhere, social distancing, 6ft apart, etc. This was the 3rd time we went there& we finally succeeded in completing our transfer& registration.<//Review>

< Text>
I prefer this DMV over the Fresno location. Typically in the past, before COVID, I was out within an hour. With or without an appt. If I came or scheduled my appt between 2 & 3pm, when parents are picking their kids up from school, it was faster.
During COVID they're not doing a whole lot in person. Don't bother taking the time off work to come in and stand in line for hours until you've looked over the hand out they're giving. I've posted it here for you to look over.
We were told If you have a driver's license or registration expired or due to expire the police are not issuing citations, they have been extended through July 31st. You can pay your fees however by dropping them off in the box out front. I did not see the extension of license and registration in writing, so be sure to verify that before taking my word for it.
We were also told if you have a question you can submit a note into the box out front, with your phone number on it, and someone will assist you by phone. Example would be, you've not received your license, registration, etc. And should have by now.
I wasted my time coming and waiting here today and am writing this for you so you don't have to waste yours. Lol! Hope it helps!< /Text>

< Name>
Cody Turner</Name>
<date>1548282321370</date>< Review>
The Clovis DMV used to be much better. You could get in and out in 20 minutes or less with friendly staff, unless they screwed up or made a mistake. Now they are constantly making mistakes, pawning you off, changed to a less efficient and longer process to get seen.

I had to come in last week to get plates replaced due to theft, instead of checking me in and validating my info like they used to, they just pushed me to a different line, waited two hours, get seen, get told that due to an internal issue from November that they were aware of my insurance hadn't been reported for the vehicle and my registration was on suspension. Even though I had the proof of insurance with me, and past cards proving I had it the whole time. I was told I had 2 choices, contact my insurance to have them call the Sacramento DMV and sort it out, or pay a reinstantment fee of $14. But, could not pay at the window, either by mail, online, or at the kiosk, since local DMV doesn't cooperate with their main office, but whatever, paid it on my phone on the spot, showed the confirmation to the clerk at the window and get told that it all looks good, but I have to wait till the next week for it to clear due to processing time and for their main office in Sacramento to bounce it back to them. Because, apparently the DMV isn't the same across the state...</Review>

<gmap_id>0x80945b944fd76265:0xa8d2edcec540ad10< /gmap_id><UserId.>100669737573227794864< /UserId.>< time>
1436905803410</time>
< Text>
I had to get my license renewed so I made an appointment at this DMV online. I went on a Tuesday morning at 10:30 a.m. I arrived at 10:40, but they still got me checked in and gave me a number. Within 45 seconds my number was called. I finished filling out my paperwork and the woman at the window processed me within 2 minutes. I got in line to take my photo, and that only took 5 minutes. Got out of that place by 11:00.

On a Tuesday morning, there were not very many people there. Everyone was quiet and respectful. It was spacious and there was lots of available seating.

I don't know what it's like when it's busier, but my experience was a positive one for a DMV. I've been to about 10 DMVs in at least 6 cities, and this was one of the better experiences.</Text>

She tried to direct me to the Non-Appointment line. Each time I tried to respond with my question, she would just cut me off mid-sentence. <rate>5<//rate>< review>
Yesterday, I gathered a random assortment of household hazardous waste materials that had accumulated over 40 years.  Not wanting to wait for the next monthly drop-off station, I struggled to find a place to drop-off the chemicals on a weekday.  Luckily, I discovered Haz Away Today.  I called them to schedule an appointment, and they were able to come the next day.   They called in the morning to confirm their arrival time, and then showed up exactly on time as promised.  And once here, the process was super easy.  The Haz Away Today representative was very nice and professional.  He sorted, weighed and hauled away all of the chemicals,  and he was diligent in not including empty bottles or items that weren‚Äôt actually hazardous waste (meaning I did not get overcharged).  All-in-all, it was a great experience and a great relief not to have all those chemicals around.   Worth every penny!<//review>

I was faced with the problem of cleaning out a garage and had quite a bit of old paint and other hazardous materials to get rid off . I really had no idea of how I was going to do it. I was able to find HazAway through a google search , and from my first phone call and through service delivery , I have been completely pleased and impressed . Ryan and Shawn arrived at my location when they said they would , and both of them were also , courteous , professional, and efficient . I would use HazAway again in a heartbeat and have already referred several family members<//review>

< review>
I placed an order on Feb 13, 2019 for an amp at a great price. Even received a confirmation email about my order. But per the email still have not received a follow up email with my tracking/shipping details and have tried 4 different methods of contacting this business and no response from any of the information they have listed via email or phone. I feel very unsettled about how this is going, so I have reached out to the BBB and hopefully I can get a response that way. This is the first time anything like this has happened to me via an online purchase and I hope this review helps anyone else in my same situation, please read reviews about a place before even considering making a purchase. Valuable lessons learned...< /review>

< date>

<Rate>1<//Rate>< text>
I ordered a PAC interface on 6/3/19. The Car Audio Giants website confirmed that it was in stock and promised a tracking number within 24-48 hours. After that time period elapsed, I reached out via email and phone to get an update. Come to find out that the phone number listed on their site was not in service and the vendor was not responsive via email. After several day of waiting for tracking info, I requested that the order be canceled. I receive an email later that day stating that the order was canceled because it was back-ordered with no ETA then the initial charge was reversed.  A week later the package showed up on my doorstep and my credit card had been charged again. Being that I had already ordered, received, and installed the PAC interface via a different vendor, I no longer needed this one. I have sent countless emails to the vendor requesting an RMA and pre-paid return shipping label but haven't gotten a response. I have since filed a dispute with my Credit Card company and will be filing a complaint with the BBB.< /text>

< text>
This place is so awesome.  I took my friend here, who shattered the BACK of her iPhone 4. Everyone I called did NOT have this replacement part, or had no idea what I was talking about.  I called Tim the day before coming, and he said "no prob! $20 and 5 minutes, it'll be good as new." YAY!

The place was a little confusing to find - it is inside a building with a bunch of other business (tattoos, massages, accupuncture - a one stop shop!).  There was a nice man sitting on the couch at the entrance who seemed to know the layout well.  He directed us immediately to Suite 2.  The whole shop is basically a closet with a work desk and some parts up on the wall.  We walked in and he was about to assist one guest ahead of us, but had remembered me from calling the day before!  My friend handed her phone over, and Tim chatted with us while he did his magic. <Rate>5</Rate><text>About 4 months ago my Galaxy S3's power port stopped working, and after calling around to a few places that said they can't fix it since the power port is attached to the main board, I found this place where I was told they could fix it.

I got to watch as my phone was disassembled, and talked to Tim as he worked on my phone about random stuff ranging from what he was doing to why I got in to computer science.  It was really great getting to watch him work as he explained to me what he was doing and showed me where the problem on the old part was.  He fixed my problem on the spot in about an hour and I walked out the door with a perfectly working phone.

Last week my phone had a different problem and I came back to Tim since he did such a great job with my first problem.  After taking my phone apart and chatting for about an hour or so, he was able to partially but not completely fix my problem.  Since he wasn't able to fully solve my problem he didn't charge me, though I insisted on paying for his time and the partial fix he was able to provide.

If anyone is in San Diego and their phone breaks, I would definitely send them over to SD Cell Phone Repair.  He definitely knows his stuff and it's nice to be able to chat with him while he's working.< /text>< Pictures>

<Text>Just came back from this place after being referred from another cell phone repair shop that is much, much closer to where I live. It was totally worth the trip; I cannot say enough good things about Tim, his friendliness, and his professionalism. He was able to quickly diagnose the problem that I had with the cell phone that I brought in (I couldn't get my new digitizer screen to work). After identifying the LCD connection as the problem (not the digitizer), he put in one of his own LCDs that happened to be laying around, and left it in, free of charge. He promptly fixed my phone back to "like-new" condition, all while teaching a nice old lady how to use a smartphone from scratch. Also while I was in his shop, Tim took a call from another guy who was trying to do-it-yourself repair his own phone, and answered many of his questions about the process. After doing some quick research on parts, he advised the guy that replacing his phone would overall be more cost-effective to him than repairing it due to the parts being expensive for that particular model. Tim's prices are extremely competitive, and I couldn't be happier with the service. A+ business, and A+ human being.<//Text></record></dataset><record>

The customer service and location of this wonderful hotel was fantastic. Stayed for the weekend and had room service breakfast. The front door concierge made our stay obsolete by allowing us to park in the front with no extra charge. I would definitely reccomend anyone to book a stay at this fabulous sf hotel.<//text>

<Rate>5<//Rate>< text>
Amazing views of the city! Loved our patio area to have our coffee in the morning and Cali cabernet in the evening. The view of the bay bridge was stunning. The bed was so comfortable, we actually would love to know the kind of pillows used so we can buy some! The staff was so accomodating with our early check in and holding our bags after check out so we could walk the city before our flight out. I was especially impressed with how clean the bathroom was in our room. Just wished the bar was open for us a little later but everything in town seemed to close a little early due to covid. Also, really wanted to enjoy room service but with all the fees it was more beneficial to just walk down the street for some food. Other than that, highly recommend! And again, would love to know what kind of pillows were in those rooms!</text>

<username>Nate Hohenstreet< /username><review>Just like the city around this hotel, Le Meridien was a very welcoming and enjoyable place to stay. From the moment of arrival, the appearance and amenities are subtly extravagant. It was refreshing to have the luxury feel that didn't rely on gaudy marble or accents. A comfortable and modern lobby and lounge provided a great place for relaxing, meeting up with others, and just enjoying conversation. The attendants at the front desk were prompt, professional, and welcoming.

The Concierge deserves their own special mention. What began as a requested recommendation for restaurants, resulted in an amazing evening and memorable dinner without a single hassle. Ben offered dining options, handled the reservations for us, provided directions, and then the restaurant treated us as VIPs simply because Le Meridien had set up our reservation!

Our accommodations were immaculate! Well furnished, very clean, beautiful views, extremely quiet, and a very comfortable bed! It was a memorable stay.

No matter when or why I travel to the Bay Area in the future, this centrally located hotel will be our destination.< /review><rate>5<//rate></record></dataset><record>
< Time>
1521694898992< /Time>
<rate>4</rate><response>None</response>< Name>
Jenn K<//Name>
< review>
Modern, upscale hotel. Great for business or leasure, it's right in the financial district with lots of bars and restaurants within walking distance. The bar in the hotel is great as well. Rooms are spacious and modern. Lots of plugs and extra seating for work or chilling, along with a large TV and big bathroom. Definitely recommend this place.< /review>

<review>For many years now I have had the honor of hosted by the staff at Le Meridien.  Always consistently a great experience from check in to check out. They make everything looks easy and with a smile. Love the coffee in the morning and fantastic selection of newspapers. The property is well taken care of, staff ever so helpful and friendly, location awesome. It makes me happy to write a review for them after all these years of great experiences.</review>< pictures>

</record></dataset><record>
< Text>
Wow! Color me impressed!

Our company had an event in San Francisco  and we had reservations, via the company, here at Le Meridien.

I had my printed reservation paperwork and it wasn't even needed. Miss Laura just asked for my ID, Credit Card info and to verify my phone number. Everything started out smooth.

I headed to my assigned room and the cleaning lady informed me that it wasn't quite ready yet. So I just went back to the desk and let Miss Laura know that I would be back. I'd grab some food and then go to my room. After some clarity, she just made arrangements for a different room.

The customer service here is awesome. Then again, I wasn't screaming or yelling that there was any kind of an issue. üòâ

So if you are in the area or if your company wants to plan an event, reach out to Le Meridien and stay a night or two.

As a side note for those who like to sight see, Le Meriden is located less than half a mile from the Exploratorium, with restaurants, bars and shops all around. A little farther down the road and you have pier 39. Come one, come all and let Le Meridien take care of your weekend. (And/or business trip.)</Text>

< Text>
The lobby/rooms were quite nice and up to date contrary to the exterior of the hotel, as a gold member I was upgraded to a Bay view room and thoroughly enjoyed my stay, there aren't any swimming pools here.  The Montgomery Bart station is walking distance as is the pier.  The entrance is on Clay street and not on Battery street in case of transportation instructions.  The room was nice although there wasn't a master switch for the whole room, so after turning on all the lights, you'd need to go one by one to turn everything off.  The bathroom although large, is a little dated and could use some remodeling to match the rest of the hotel. The bathroom products by MALIN+GOETZ were nice. There is free Illy coffee in the 3rd floor and a Starbucks across the street.< /Text>

< Text>
The staff were incredible and polite, so no problems there. The hotel location was perfectly positioned in the financial district, which allowed easy access to a majority of the things we wanted to do. However, the hotel was a little dated. It didn't have a smart TV like most Marriott hotels and the interior color scheme, blinds, and furniture were cool ten years ago. Overall, the service was impeccable but the rooms were not to our taste. My wife and I would visit again if the cost or accommodations were adjusted to be representative of each other.</Text>

<Review>I stay here whenever I can! The decor is very pretty and the bar/restaurant downstairs never disappoints. It can get a bit crowded with 40 and over crowd though on a Friday night. The rooms are usually great. The only time I had an issue was when the housekeeper missed an entire bag of McDonalds behind the curtain. Who eats McDonald's when you're at this place anyway? The beds and pillows are very comfortable and clean. The location can't be beat since you're at the Embarcadero Center and a 40-50 minute walk or so (speed varies!) from Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf.<//Review>< Pics>

<rate>None<//rate><review>Picked Le Meridien based on location for a quick stay in the city - close to restaurants, walkable to Chinatown, Columbus, Downtown and the Embarcadero. Hotel feels brand new and totally up to date. Every member of staff we interacted with was efficient and friendly - even the room staff we passed in the corridor were a treat. The room and view were stunning and the Illy coffee and Eclairs are indulgent but worth it. Lots of Bonvoy hotels to chose from in San Francisco but Le Meridien will be our first choice.< /review>< Pictures>

< Text>
It was the first NYE for my girlfriend and I to spend together.  We decided to spend it in SF and when we pulled up we were greeted by very friendly staff that took our bags and valet our car.  We escorted in and given a very warm welcome by the front desk.  Chris at the front desk was very accommodating and gave us a beautiful room over looking the port (where we later watched the fireworks from our room).  Our bellman brought up all of our luggage and hung up our clothes in the closet for us.  Top notch service by a very friendly staff.  We will definitely be coming back to stay again.  Thank you Le Meridien and the entire staff for making our stay so memorable.</Text>

<rating>None</rating>< Text>
Le Meridien is a fabulous hotel to stay in.
Although targeted at the business market we were a family on holiday and found the hotel met our needs perfectly.
It was quiet at night and walking distance to China town and the Italian restaurants in North Beach.
Not too far either to Fishermans Wharfe and Union Square.
Rooms were wonderful and beds were very comfy.
If you want a view ask for a room with City View.<//Text>

< text>
We chose Le Meridien as our 11th-anniversary accommodations because it seemed to have a great price for the location and considering it is a 4-star hotel. We were not disappointed. Check-in was so easy and the staff was so helpful. We were impressed with the chic design of the bar, lobby and other areas. We were upgraded to a suite because of our anniversary and we had every accommodation at our fingertips. The smallest touches make the difference, as seeing the genuine smiles on the doormen each time they opened the door was priceless. Our view was spectacular! The Lotus structure at the Embarcadero Center and the Bay Bridge lit up were amazing. Not to mention it was central to BART and our restaurant. So much within walking distance.<//text>

< text>

< Rate>

< review>
My family stayed at Le Meridien for the weekend as we were attending a family wedding next door.  We had two rooms, one which was not ready at arrival but was ready within the hour.  My son arrived straight from the airport and had to immediately connect to the internet to take a college final and the internet was fine, no problems.  The rooms were clean, large and well laid out.  Staff was welcoming, helpful and every one was just as nice as the next.  The concierge did her best to find us a last minute dinner reservation for 13 to no avail as we did not plan ahead but all worked out fine. She would have kept trying until something was found but we were okay on our own.   
The following day, as we were walking out to the wedding I received a frantic call that the bride needed something last minute. I was able to go to concierge, explain what I needed and leave for wedding-the concierge handled it and upon return to hotel before reception let me know I would receive  a call to pick up item so bride has what was needed by end of night.  All done with a s,I Le on their faces.  
We wish we didn‚Äôt live so close so we had an excuse to come back!  Don‚Äôt hesitate to stay at Le Meridien, located close to Union Square, North Beach, pier 39 and the Ferry b
building.  Perfect location and wonderful staff!< /review>

<review>We enjoyed our stay.
We chose le Meridien based on its location and price per night

The room was lovely and quite large, that bathroom was a decent size and the bedding was comfortable. We found that we had plenty of room for storing our clothes and we enjoyed our short down time by watching tv on a huge tv screen.

Check in was easy and the staff was pleasant.

The drive up and lobby could use a little work: the drive up was filthy and dirty not to mention cold-but service was excellent-the lobby could use some pizazz and warmth.

We had one robe in the room for 2 guests.

The value was good for SF and for what we were doing that night-the location was perfect.</review>< Pics>

<Date>1563062400000<//Date><rating>None< /rating><text>The property is dated but clean. It is close to major tourist attractions and is at a walkable distance to the pier. Hence convenient for tourist explorations around the city. The property itself isn't very astonishing & the rooms & decor is pretty dated. 

During my stay, there wasn't a (significant) recognition of my Titanium Elite status & no room upgrades were provided. The property doesn't have a lounge and the breakfast offered at the restaurant is just meh. It was one of the "restricted" continental breakfast I had in a full service Marriott recently. 

In short, pick this property if you really need to be close to the pier and if the rates are discounted. For a full price, there are many other Marriott's in the city which are far better than Le Meridian SF.</text>< pictures>

<Text>The lobby/rooms were quite nice and up to date contrary to the exterior of the hotel, as a gold member I was upgraded to a Bay view room and thoroughly enjoyed my stay, there aren't any swimming pools here.  The Montgomery Bart station is walking distance as is the pier.  The entrance is on Clay street and not on Battery street in case of transportation instructions.  The room was nice although there wasn't a master switch for the whole room, so after turning on all the lights, you'd need to go one by one to turn everything off.  The bathroom although large, is a little dated and could use some remodeling to match the rest of the hotel.  There is free Illy coffee in the 3rd floor and a Starbucks across the street.< /Text>< Pics>

<time>1505402548006</time><Response>None<//Response>< GmapID>
0x8085806033e06771:0x5585cb03086b5f0f<//GmapID>
<Text>My short stay here was great!

I arrived late in the night after fighting flight delays all evening. I was greeted immediately and the concierge began to review my reservation and carried out his script of information - short, thorough, and simple, which was about as much as I could handle given the timing.

I was given a double bed room, which was ample for just me. I found the accommodations very comfortable and the ease of finding all the essentials was great. There was a charging port for my electronics right next to my bed, and I was able to easily access and use the iron to get my clothes ready for the morning.

The bed was firm and easy to fall asleep in. The bed was lined with plenty of blankets, and I was able to modify the temperature in the room to my specifications with ease.

In the morning, the breakfast was great - full continental! Definitely go for the russet potatoes! I added a bit of Tabasco sauce for a hearty start to the day.

Overall - the ease from checking in and checking out was the best part. I am hoping for more stays in the future!< /Text></record></dataset><record>

<Text>Hard to give 5 star compared to other Le Meridien.

View was good.
Room was little small but maybe similar to other hotels in San Francisco.

The hotel is amazing! My boyfriend and I were spending the weekend in SF and so happy that we chose this hotel. Fortunately, we got to the hotel early and instead of getting a room on the 20th floor that would have been a normal size room, we got a suite with balcony on the 8th floor (corner unit) with amazing views of the bay bridge and Oakland hills. The staff were all great and the room was huge and clean! I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend this hotel to those looking for a quiet area to stay yet close enough to local bars/lounges and great restaurants.<//Review>

< Review>
I stayed here several times and i think it keeps getting better. Last visit i had a corner suite and it was terrific. Overlooking the Embarcadero Center and the Bay Bridge. Very nicely appointed, very comfortable. Love the walk in shower. And even had a balcony.

The bar has a great vibe, though i wish they would serve food later ( I think they stop at 10). 

Morning breakfast spread is very good.

Great location at the Embarcadero Center. Easy access to North Beach, Jackson Square, Chinatown, etc.

Very nice front desk staff too.

HIghly recommend.</Review>

<Review>We spent a Labor Day weekend here and it was pretty nice.
Though there were some issues

‚Ä¢ The parking fee is $75 a day. So we parked at the Embarcadero Center $35 a day. I mean, we drove all the way from LA to SF, and we have to pay $75 for parking while staying at the hotel, it doesn‚Äôt make sense.

‚Ä¢ To be able to connect WiFi, you have to pay $14 or so for a day, or if you are a Marriott member, then it‚Äôs free.
I didn‚Äôt really pay attention to the smaller print under the price that it was free for a Marriott  member, so we didn‚Äôt really connect to WiFi .
We do have unlimited att service so it wasn‚Äôt a big deal. Though it is really something that I can‚Äôt understand why it‚Äôs being charged.

‚Ä¢Along the hallway there is a water dispenser with fruits inside, which is amazing ! I just wish they could have used normal glasses, instead of so many plastic cups there. They can do better for the environment!

<Text>My family and I stayed at this location day after Christmas. We had 2 Jr Suites and 1 full suite reserved, all with views. We were celebrating my father's 90th birthday and had requested an early checkin. I had called in ahead of time.

- Upon arrival at 3pm (note, not even an early checkin), our rooms were not ready. The staff was less than accommodating, and we had to escalate to the manager. 
- Our suite, meant to accommodate 3 people had 1 hand towel and two bath towels, no wash clothes.
- The beds in the rooms had no fitted sheets, and just one flat sheet covering the mattress (no cover for the duvet). I called housekeeping and was told that because of Christmas, the hotel was short on linen!!!!!!!
- The pullout sofa was very uncomfortable, with minimal padding.
- The rooms had no coffee machines.
- There was NO recognition of my father's special birthday, despite several requests.
- I am an SPG (and corporate) member, but they told me because we had booked through Expedia, our rooms do not qualify for the free wifi.

On the positive side:
- The views of the rooms were great.
- Proximity to embarcadero and Ferry building was great.
- The valet staff was very attentive.< /Text><pictures>None</pictures><resp>None<//resp>< GmapID>

< text>
We stayed at Le Meridien for 3 days in late October. The hotel is just wonderful;staff is smart and customer oriented. I highly recommend Le Meridien for any trip to SF-oh yeah,weekend prices are very reasonable< /text>

< Text>
My husband and I have stayed here once before and loved it, so we thought it would be the perfect place to stay to ring in the new year. Apparently, everyone else had the same idea and the staff didn't really know how to handle it well. We arrived early - around 1:30pm and asked if it was possible to check in. We were told that we could have a room on a lower floor (5) now or, as SPG members, could be upgraded to a higher floor but would have to come back at 3pm to get our room key, as the room wasn't ready yet. Of course we decided to do this and promptly checked our luggage with the bellhop. We ended up coming back at 4:15pm, well after the 3pm check in time stated on our reservation (and reiterated by the desk clerk), only to be told that our room was still not ready. While waiting, I overheard 2 other desk clerks tell other guests that their rooms were also not ready, as the hotel had had many late check out requests for that day, as late as 2pm. Long story short (ha!) we were told our room would still not be ready for another 45 minutes, yet by this point we had already recovered our luggage from the bellhop and were supposed to meet friends at 5pm. After much time spent researching available rooms, the desk clerk ended up giving us a lower room floor (6) that was less than what our reservation had stated (king superior) with no upgrades, points, or anything to make up for our wait or their lack of planning. When I asked about the wireless code, she said it was not part of our room package. The room itself was fine - no view, mediocre bathtub/shower, comfy bed - but I was disappointed in the service and will not plan on staying here again. The customer service and amenities are far nicer at the other SPG hotels in SF we love</Text>

< text>
Decided to go to San Francisco for New Years because a few friends had never been. I booked the Le Meridien and we made the drive up from SoCal. Upon arrival, the valet parking was quick and attentive. The lobby construction was still going on, but it was easy to figure out where to go for check in.

We were given the Canberra Suite which had a decent view of the bay. The room was very nice and clean.

The location made for an easy walk to surrounding areas, such as the Embarcadero.

I would definitely recommend the hotel to friends.<//text>

< text>
From the moment the car wrangler takes your car to the smooth and upbeat tone of check-in to the absolutely staggering north and east facieng views to the lovely chocolate-dipped strawberries and sparkling wine brought to us as an acknowledgement of our honeymoon travel (smoothly and graciously switched to sparkling water when they learned we don't drink the boozeahol) to the concierge helping us to decipher the vagaries of GGB toll crossings to the team effort required to load out our myriad and varied luggage, this stay was excellent. Spent Christmas and NYE here with my wife and it was wonderful..  We celebrated our 1st wedding anniversary with friends that live in the area. The hotels has  clean rooms and  great service. <Rating>1< /Rating>< text>
First, I would like to say the hotel was very nice and clean, but not centrally located at all. I do not have the right words to describe my disappointment in the staff and the treatment on the phone prior to our arrival. After very hectic and disappointing flight cancellations due to weather, the hotel management was unwilling to work with us on reimbursement or credit toward a future stay. Then on arrival, a day late, (after calling to talk through situation and confirm we were still coming) it was so obvious they gave our room away and scrambled to put us in an upgraded room which was right next to penthouse with screaming/partying all night long. Disappointed is an understatement. I thought someone would follow up with me after writinf corporate, but have heard nothing.</text>

< Review>
PROS
- Location is close to FiDi, BART, and all the downtown areas you need to get to
- Malin & Goetz bath products
- Super comfy bed
- Nice view of the Bay Bridge
- Awesome staff

CONS
- Sound insulation in the rooms is awful (bring earplugs)
- Not a single vegetarian entree on the menu (surprising for a hotel in SF)
- Had to ask for more shampoo, etc.
- Way overpriced

Overall, it's a nice hotel. Not the best I've ever stayed in, but it's nice. I wouldn't recommend it, mostly because I think it's about twice as expensive as it's worth. But if you don't mind paying extra, go for it!</Review>

<time>1391904000000< /time><Text>It's been a few years since I've stayed here. I'm looking back at my review from four years ago and wondering what I was thinking. While this Le Meridien is classy and comfy, it's in need of a re-vamp to keep it on par with four or five stars.

The location can't be beat if you want to be in super close proximity to the hundreds of companies in the immediate financial district. However, like many reviews have highlighted, the area is dead at night (which may be a plus for some weary business travelers). It's also a quick 3-minute walk to the Ferry Building which, if you've never been to San Fran, is a place you're going to want to spend as much time in as possible.

Using my SPG Suite Night Awards, I was upgraded to a Business Suite which was a fairly fascinating experience. You walk in to the main bedroom--fairly spacious with a large king bed, chair, dresser and large TV. There is also a teeny balcony with a chair and great views of the bay (see photos). Occupying a corner of the hotel, this Suite also features a large full office complete with large desk, credenza and yes, A FAX MACHINE. You know y'all, I was so thankful bc I had so much faxing to do during my 2014 business trip. The bathroom is large with a huge window for plenty of light. However, it has a nasty shower/tub combination not particularly fitting of a supposed luxury hotel. The room was clean, the sheets soft. the towels worn and reminding me of ones I had seen at Motel 6. My takeaway on the room is that it's a few years overdue for a total refresh.

No coffee makers in rooms. Annoying especially bc the free coffee in the hotel restaurant is only available in the morning.

FREE SHOE SHINE!

With so many awesome hotel choices in San Fran, I'd give LM another shot if the rates were really low.<//Text><gmap_id>0x8085806033e06771:0x5585cb03086b5f0f<//gmap_id><pictures>None<//pictures>< user_id>
None< /user_id>

< Rating>

<text>My wife and I traveled to San Francisco for the Memorial Day weekend and found a great rate at this hotel that included parking (regularly $52.00/night) as part of the hotel package for under $200.00/night.

The hotel is very modern - very nice lobby and great location that is close to shopping. It is located in more of a "business" district - but is within walking distance (20 minute walk) to Pier 39, and a short walk (2-3 minutes) to Chinatown and Nob Hill area.

Room was on a high floor and had a limited view of the Bay Bridge. The bed was very comfortable - great TV and very nice bathroom. We did not utilize the hotel restaurant or bar.

The staff was great - valets were very helpful in giving directions/etc. Would definitely recommend this hotel.< /text>< Pics>

1338422400000</Time>
<rating>None</rating>< review>
Just stayed for an old friend's wedding. Le Meridien is a class act in every sense of the word. Service was discreet and highly professional. Bernadette at check-in was fantastic and savvy. Staff always smiled at me and made me feel like a welcomed guest.

My room was upgraded to a fantastic suite on an upper floor that had a beautiful balcony with sweeping views of the bay, downtown, and the bay bridge. From the bedroom reading chair, I could see the Transamerica building. From the fluffy down comforter on the bed, I could see the bay. Ahhh..... memories.

I seriously did not want to leave my room, it was so luxurious and comfortable. Hotel was close enough to Telegraph Hill for me to go on a gorgeous run through rose gardens up to Coit Tower.

The hotel staff had a big part in helping create a warm space for my friend's wedding to happen in. They treated everybody like Kings. Thank you, Le Meridien!</review>

<rating>None<//rating><text>No acknowledgement of gold status on arrival.
No upgrades etc.
When I inquired about wifi cost for gold status was given a bit of a lecture about booking using the correct channels (Someone else books my hotels normally) and including the number on the booking (it was on my confirmation email but not the reservation)
Lighting in the room consists of a light-up picture frame that shines in your face and several standalone lamps that are difficult to reach from the bed (I rearranged). Reading lamp would be helpful, as well as a bed-reachable switch to shut everything off. 
"desk" area is a terrible barstool arrangement - we've got three people for 5-7 nights each (about $6K) in town who need to work but can't use the room to work due to terrible stool and bad 'desk' height. 
Food pretty average and pricey.
Decent location. Good view. Decent bed.

The hotel room is modern, clean, and your regular amenities.  The staff is friendly.  Located within 10 to 15 minute walking distance or a quick Uber/Lyft ride to Pier 39 or Union Square.  Very close to China town but there's nothing left to see there.

The only downside is overnight parking at hotel is a whopping $79 per night, and the faucet trickles water (shower is normal).

I would definitely stay here again.< /review>

< Gmap_id>
0x8085806033e06771:0x5585cb03086b5f0f<//Gmap_id>
< review>
This hotel is the most convenient Starwood property to San Francisco's Embarcadero Center, which makes it a highly convenient location for business. It's also walking distance to lots of great restaurants.

Rooms are modern, very comfortable, and by San Francisco standards, spacious. Most of the times I've stayed here as a Platinum guest, I've been upgraded to a suite; these are huge, have great views, and have a elegant, contemporary look. This is definitely comfort over glitz.

The bar is a great place to have a drink, and the food there is good as well; it's quiet enough to have a meeting or a pleasant conversation. This is a business and upscale leisure travelers sort of scene, not a "buzz" kind of place.

The restaurant serves a terrific breakfast (a la carte), and it's a great place for a business meeting -- quiet, comfortable, service is attentive but unobtrusive. There's no particular reason to eat lunch or dinner here, though, with the abundance of other excellent eateries in the area.

The meeting rooms here are also decent, although the wi-fi reach isn't as strong as one might consider ideal.

Overall, if you're looking to stay in the Embarcadero Center area, and you're willing to pay a little extra, this is well worthwhile.<//review>
</record>

<Text>Below was the email I sent to the hotel the last night I stayed there. After all the things they failed to meet as a SPG category 5 hotel, they yet again ignored this email. There was no apology, nor recognition of receiving it. Absolute radio silence.

Hi there,
It's my first time staying with your hotel and I feel I'd like to share my not so satisfying experience so far.

8/1
I checked in and immediately noticed the careless house keeping job done in this room. The keeper placed two bottles of shampoo and no shower gel, the shower cap box is empty inside.

8/2
I left two dollar bills on the side table for tips. When I returned, I was surprised to find that there was no refill of the the shampoo, conditioner, or lotion. The keeper has not checked and found the shower gel is missing. The tips were taken but a cup of water on the table was spilled and the keeper did not bother to wipe it. Left the water on the table and some water soaked Meridien notepads. I took the plastic cups in the room to use on my Sunday picnic and they were not filled either.

I hung my clothes in the closet and saw the SUPER DUSTY shades of the closet door as the light in the closet turned on automatically. Later on, when I brushed my teeth, I somehow got to a right angle and spotted the filthy inside of the toilet rim.

I have decided the housekeeping department is terribly managed and has no cleaning SOP, which I didn't expect from a SPG Category 5 facility. I also decided that the room is probably not cleaner with housekeeping so I declined my service for the next day.

8/3
I called to request for my water and an extra towel since I declined house keeping for the day. A 50-60 year old African American guy delivered it to my room. When I said thank you, he might be disappointed that I was not tipping him. Abruptly, he turned and walked away without giving me another look. I could't help but wonder what is happening to your hotel.

Finally, your WiFi is terrible. It is super slow for even accessing web pages. It is slower than any of the hotels I have stayed in China.This is not right to be slower than a country where internet is censored and this is shameful to have that speed in the Bay Area. I saw other people complained about the same thing. Please have it fixed.

I just had the most satisfying stay in your St. Regis Chengdu. As a customer, I saw a team working together and cared for every details of their job to be able to do it so right. As the same SPG Category 5 hotel, you are failing customer expectation and your reputation.

All the negative comments being said, I think the front desk staff is the best in this hotel. They are welcoming, quick to take action on service calls, and professional.

That was all I wanted to say and I wish you run a better hotel in the future.< /Text>< UserId.>

< Review>
This is a fantastic hotel in a great spot! The rooms are extremely comfortable with great amenities throughout. It is within walking distance to two Bart stations as well as the Muni Metro. It was raining while I was visiting and there are complementary umbrellas in the room for use which was very helpful. The bar in the lobby stays open to a decent hour which is good considering there is not much open too late in the nearby area but the train being nearby helps in case you do want to venture out. The beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms are very nicely appointed with luxurious towels.<//Review>

<GmapID>0x8085806033e06771:0x5585cb03086b5f0f<//GmapID></record></dataset><record>
<pics>None<//pics><Rating>5<//Rating>< text>
Room was clean and spacious and we got a high room with a great view. It was great that you could open the window partially to get fresh air while sleeping. The hotel is a short walk to the Ferry Building, Chinatown, a little further to the North Beach district, and close to one of the cable car route stops.Just be aware, being the financial district, many of the cafes/eateries are only open during the day Mon-Fri. No breakfast is included but there are no shortage of eateries close by Mon-Fri. On a weekend you may need to resort to Subway. There's a bar downstairs where we had a cocktail, they offer small bites and also there is a small adjacent restaurant for meals which appeared reasonably priced.<//text>

<user_id>None</user_id>< user_name>
SBTX</user_name>
< Time>
1355270400000< /Time>
< rating>
None<//rating>
< Text>
We didn't see that the hotel was under renovations when we booked online. So, when we arrived and realized they were in the middle of a renovation, I thought the rooms would be noisy, and expected an impatient staff. I was pleasantly surprised, and in fact, received outstanding and warm customer service. The bell man was very personable and eager to show us the shortcut to the elevator - even though I am sure he'd done it a thousand times. The front desk, even though in a make shift lounge due to the construction, were smiling, quick in checking in, genuinely upbeat. We were on the Starwood Preferred floor, with a beautiful view. The room was immaculate, and we enjoyed the amenities. We heard no noise, and slept great through the night. We both travel quite a bit for work, and typically stay at 4 star hotels and up. The most important things in our experience are 1) the cleanliness of the room 2) the ease of location / amenities 3) the service. Le Meriden San Francisco was right on spot with delivering every thing we needed to make the stay enjoyable.</Text>

<Rating>None<//Rating><Pictures>None</Pictures>< review>
Why do I choose Le Meridien first when I visit San Francisco?

Location: It's nestled in the Financial District, and I can walk to several great places from the hotel (City Lights Books, the Financial Building, Union Square). When I'm unsure of where to go, the concierge, valet, AND door man come together to brainstorm with me.

Service: I've always been respected and treated like a friend at the hotel. All staff I've met have been kind and helpful.

Art!: The rooms and marketing are adorned with local student art work. What a great aesthetic investment!

Amenities: The workout room has a range of LifeStyle fitness equipment that is well maintained and contemporary.

SPG: I get points for having the Le Meridien experience each time I visit. How neat is that?</review>

< date>
1359504000000</date>
< Review>
Overall, the hotel was a big disappointment. For starters, I received no warning whatsoever that the hotel was undergoing a major renovation. Even locating the "front door" to the hotel (behind the construction wall) was difficult! Once inside the hotel, guests are forced to take what is essentially a freight elevator up to the second floor where you then find a makeshift checkin desk. As I was accompanied by a business associate, these conditions were rather embarassing. And things didn't get any better... Notwithstanding only an hour earlier SPG.COM reflected that I'd received a Platinum upgrade to a Studio Suite, I was told at check-in that I was actually assigned to an "Executive" room (the manager on duty rather unapologetically insisted the change was due to a need to "balance the hotel" whatever that means... Of course this so-called Executive room (1509) was directly adjacent to the elevators, included a dirty plastic cup atop the dresser, and had none of the usual amenities (not even complimentary bottled water which I thought was standard)... I had to go to the front desk to remind them to send water bottles up to the room. Would not have booked this hotel had I known of the renovation and it's pretty outrageous the hotel conceals this fact from its guests (website contains no "special conditions" advisory no any other hint of what guests can expect). My only positive comment would be to acknowledge the good customer service shown by the young woman who checked me in. She was genuinely sorry for the last minute swap from a suite to a standard room and I appreciated that she tried (unsuccessfully) to have the manager find an alternative.< /Review>

<Rating>None</Rating><Text>I work in the neighborhood but needed a hotel for a weekend in the City -- first time at this property and would definitely come back. Got upgraded to a 2 room balcony suite with an amazing panoramic view from the Bay Bridge over to North Beach!

Great location -- a bit quiet on weekends, but close to Ferry Building for Farmer's Market, and plenty of great resturaunts close by.

Staff was great, we were able to check in early. Great little business center to print out Opera tickets, and no problem getting a taxi.

The bed was SO comfortable (and I'm picky). Bedroom has floor to ceiling windows, but great drapes that blocked out the morning sun.

Only complaint -- 2 chairs on balcony would be nice, we had to drag a desk chair outside. I also would've liked a sofa in the sitting room, instead of several individual easy chairs.

Will definitely stay here again and recommend to my business colleagues when they're in town.<//Text>< Pictures>

<user_name>Peter Nguyen<//user_name>< userid>
103745014842793538212</userid>
< Rating>
5</Rating>
<Pictures>None</Pictures>< Review>
The hotel was amazing. The hotel room was clean bright and modern. There are minor things that make the hotel excellent. The staff is extremely courteous, proactively reaching for the door to hold open and more than enthusiastic to answer your questions. The room has minor touches that exude quality such as the soft close cabinet drawers and USB charging ports at the bedside and desk. Beautiful stone surfaces adorn each counter top. I can not overstate this, this hotel is fantastic. A minor gripe is that since it is in the financial district, a lot of the restaurants near it are closed on Saturday and Sunday. However, if you're willing to walk, Union square and Chinatown are only minutes away. This is actually a bonus for me. This makes the hotel more quiet at night but is still within quick walking distance from a lot of the must see sights.</Review>

<review>Classy hotel in San Francisco's Financial district. This means that it is somewhat removed from the major sights (Union Square is a 10-minute walk away), but is therefore very quiet and peaceful on the weekends. Masculine tony d√©cor throughout the hotel (really like the color scheme and marble). As a SPG Platinum member, almost always get a nice upgrade to a suite with spectacular views of the Bay. Fitness center is well-equipped and service is also top-notch. One slight drawback is that the neighborhood shuts down early and the hotel bar also closes relatively early on the weekends, so you will just need to take a taxi to access the vibrant San Francisco nightlife (which was not a big deal for me).< /review><pics>None< /pics><Response>None</Response>< Gmap_id>

<text>We received an excellent deal on a large, comfortable suite, and the view (with balcony) of the Bay Bridge all the way to North Beach was stunning.

The bathroom and amenities were great (even a window in the bathroom), though there was no separate shower.

The bed was very comfortable. The furniture in the room was tasteful modern, but a bit hard and unwelcoming. A plush seating area to match the plushness of the bed would have been perfect.

One strange thing, however, which I didn't even consider until I noted the number of Starwood Hotels in the San Francisco area while 'registering'. It became necessary for us to stay in San Francisco longer than we had planned, and when we asked the front desk whether we could possibly extend our stay, they regretfully told us that they were completely booked. Understandable, but that was where it ended. No checking other Starwood Hotels, not even a referral toward one or the other. It seems an overlooked opportunity.

Overall, though, very nice hotel.< /text><Name>PJG1< /Name></record>

< review>
This hotel is one that I usually choose when I have to be in San Francisco for business or pleasure.

This time I was in town for work, and before checking in that evening I already had a CRAZY day full of non-stop meetings and putting out fires on deals. By the time I got to check-in that evening, I had been up for about 15 hours already and was frazzled. The front desk staff recognized me as a Platinum member, gave me a complimentary drink certificate, and then said "Oh, and we have a really nice room for you, hope do you get some rest and enjoy your stay." I had booked a standard room, and I remembered they were pretty nice anyway, so didn't think too much about that.

Then I went to my room, and I had been upgraded to a humongous, well appointed suite -- the NY Suite! It was extremely comfortable and had great views of the city and the Bay Bridge. I had all my local friends come and hang out in my living room that weekend, and it was a blast. Really made me feel that Platinum membership had some great benefits, and that the hotel staff really cared. They honestly could have just given me the room I had booked, and everything would have been fine...but they really did manage to impress me with the suite.

I will definitely come back and recommend to all my friends.<//review>

<review>My girlfriend and I went to San Francisco for our anniversary. We were given a hotel room upgrade and free drinks coupons to their wonderful bar (333 Bar). Our room was amazing! TravelinBanker<//username>
<Date>1353024000000<//Date>< rate>
None</rate>
< Review>
I'm traveling more on business, and typically requiring an overnight stay in San Francisco. Le Meridien continues to be my hotel of choice. The facilities are more "boutique" like than other hotels in the area, which tend to be too big, and have a "behemoth" quality to them. Le Meridient is cozy, while at the same time offering all the comforts of a larger hotel. On this stay, the staff "upgraded" my room on check-in, but the only difference I could notice was that the room had a narrow view of the bay bridge. Either way, I'll be coming back, and I will gladly recommend this hotel to others who need accommodations in the financial district of San Francisco.</Review>

<Time>1403654400000<//Time>< text>
Stayed at Le Meridien for vacation.
Was awoken from a nap from the fire alarm in the hotel going off and a scary message to "cease activity" and proceed to the nearest exit. Turns out it was a false alarm. I think this should have been monitored more closely and possibly stopped sooner since it turns out a non-english speaking person got confused and pulled the fire lever right near the check in counter when there was no fire. I was also awoken from angry staff/locals boycotting the hotel since, according to them, Le Meridien doesn't treat staff fairly. Who knows the truth. Point is, picketers were loud, obnoxious, and tried to stop me and my mother as we left the building and shoved information pieces of the boycot in our faces. Other than that, staff NOT boycotting were friendly, beds were comfortable, free cofee was good. The Manager comped our dinner for the inconvienience of the boycott being so disruptive. Facility was clean and concierge was super helpful and recommended some great spots for breakfast. Wished some of the breakfast items for hotel room service were more affordable because we would have stayed in more.< /text>

< Review>
Check-in during construction was fine due to front desk making sure we got a nice view. Beds are usually comfy. However the bottom sheet (non-fitted) was tattered and was the only thing separating us from the mattress. So, you move a couple of times and the mattress is exposed. Not acceptable.
The other downfall is the bar. It took 15 minutes to make 2 drinks that were not that good. Many say that this is subjective. I say, never mind the price, the french martini was overly sweet and the mojito was lacking any flavor...with a couple of sprigs of mint. Working in the industry, my column will reflect the lack of care they take on the simplest of pleasures. And let's not even get into the attitude of the server and bartender. They are evidently in the wrong line of work.< /Review>

<Pics>None< /Pics>< Resp>

<review>My fiancee and I stayed here recently and we couldn't be happier. As a Platinum member, they upgraded us to a brand new suite with a bay view balcony. They're in the process of revamping all the rooms and you will not be disappointed.
We checked out for 2 days and went up to Napa, prior to leaving we asked for the same room upon returning and they had no problem giving it to us. Finally, our flight got canceled (we live in Boston) and they extended us, again without having to move rooms.
The lobby and front desk staff we're great, always greeted with a smile and they remembered who we were.
While it is in the financial district, we walked pretty much everywhere we wanted to go; COIT Tower, Fishermans Wharf, Union Sq, China Town, North Beach...ect, ect. Granted, some of these places are over a mile away so be prepared but it is a great place to stay if you're willing to take a trek (given all the great food in SF, we needed it!).
Look forward to coming back to see these folks again< /review><date>1424563200000</date><user_name>NDuzzi</user_name><Rate>None<//Rate></record></dataset><record>

The Le Meridien in San Francisco has undergone a complete remodel of their lobby and it looks fabulous. When we arrived early they had our room ready, which we had requested. The bay view room had a fantastic view of the Bay Bridge and Treasure Island. The hotel is in a great location right downtown near the Ferry Building. You can walk to many sites or hop on public transportation and see the city.</Text>

I've always enjoyed staying at the Le Meridien because of its friendly and helpful staff and its proximity to the waterfront. I love starting my day with a run along the Embarcadero. I've never had a bad stay here.<//review>

<date>1496361600000< /date>< Rating>
None< /Rating>
< review>
I visit San Francisco regularly but pay a visit to Le Meridien San Francisco the first time which I also believe will be the last one...
Hotel reception or managers are just not available by email. I sent an email ahead of my stay as I had some concerns reading reviews about noise associated with demonstrations they had around the hotel. I wanted to make sure that I am getting high floor room and if possible direction which is away from the expected demonstration. 
I booked a Studio Suite with king size bed.

To get a response from the assistance front desk MGR took 3 reminders as well as 3/4 emails to SPG Platinum Customer Services.... it was very clear at this point that this hotel is poorly managed but as it was a short stay and I arrive late to book another hotel I decided to stay but would gladly share my experience with you so you may have the benefit of knowing in advance what you are to expect.

Front desk assistant confirmed a high floor room, I was allocated 14th floor ( out of 24 floors) I would not call it specifically a very high floor.
I was told that my room was upgraded - yes it was to the next category but ( and there is always a but in this property) with small queen size bed which is very small generally and specifically to a suite.
As SPG life time member I was given breakfast taken which I was told by reception can give a $30 credit. Again when trying it this morning there was a but.... I left the vouchers at the resturant as I have no intention to start my mornings with long discussion about the voucher and the small prints associated with it.... 
no need for the hotel manager to respond. He has ample of opportunities to do so.< /review>

Stayed here for a night since I had job interviews the next day.

We reserved through the SPG website and were not disappointed. <name>Kaleberg<//name><date>1324512000000</date><rate>None<//rate>< review>
We have been staying at this hotel since before it was a Le Meridien, and it has always been our oasis in San Francisco. The rooms are large and comfortable. They are quiet and the windows have both great views and great black out curtains. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable and hard working. They will go the extra mile. We will definitely be coming back.

Our only complaints are minor. The bathroom has sliding doors which compromise privacy, and the Christmas music in the lobby and elevators was way TOO LOUD. We weren't the only guests to notice this, and it led to some amusing banter in the elevators. We could retreat to our room, but this must have been rough on the staff.</review>

<Review>I actively avoid properties that allow smoking anywhere on the premises, and chose to stay at this property in part because it appeared in the SPG search for smoke-free properties. On the Features page, it states "Experience a fresh approach at this Le M√©ridien ‚Äì a completely smoke-free environment." and "100% Non-Smoking Rooms and Facilities."

HOWEVER, on the Announcements page it states the REAL policy, which is "All guest rooms and public spaces in the hotel are now 100% non-smoking. A 250 USD penalty will be charged for smoking in guest rooms. Smoking is permitted on outdoor room balconies and on the Park Grill terrace only." The room balconies is a big deal, because some rooms without balconies do have sliding glass doors to the outside, which allows smoke from adjacent rooms' balconies to waft in. It also creates the potential for guest confusion about whether the room has a "balcony" area. When I checked in, I had one of these rooms and it did smell heavily of smoke.

I e-mailed SPG and asked that they update the Features page to remove the deceptive information about the smoking policy.<//Review><Pictures>None< /Pictures>< resp>
None< /resp>

Ellie62< /Name>

< rate>
None</rate>
< Review>
I enjoyed my stay in San Francisco but found the overall hotel staff attitude less than accommodating. The front desk and concierge staff were great. But, the room cleaning staff less so. After each visit, I had to request a face towel and wash cloth. One time I returned to the room to pick up a sweater and the woman cleaning demanded to see my ID. I appreciated her concern for security but she needs to work on her "manners." The bar tender was RUDE on each occasion I visited the bar. Finally the bell men demanded payment for helping transport boxes -- understandably they expected payment and they were certainly going to be tipped generously - but unacceptable for them to to demand payment after the fact. When asked about this "demand," their "supervisor" complained about an earlier failure to "tip" when in fact they had been tipped quite generously. While I understand the need for gratuities in a service job, this behavior seems at odds with the image conveyed by the Meridien. Members of the staff came off as a bit greedy and grasping -- not what one expects from an expensive and highly touted hotel. I live on the east coast which is often maligned for its lack of courtesy and gentility. Yet, I have not had this experience in NYC or Boston hotels. Nonetheless, it's a lovely hotel -- though a bit rough around the edges.<//Review>

<gmap_id>0x8085806033e06771:0x5585cb03086b5f0f<//gmap_id><user>None<//user><Rate>None<//Rate><Time>1406505600000<//Time><text>I stayed here for business. The room, while sizable, was dark - carpet, walls, drapes. The bathroom was clean, spacious. The bed was comfortable. The internet was easy to connect and worked very well. The toilet's high-powered (think cruise ship) flushing system had some kinks in it and produced a piercing whistling noise that would last until I flushed it again. Five times this happened during the night. The concierge didn't appear surprised, was very kind, and made arrangements to have it fixed. The hotel is convenient to the financial district, the lobby bar is very pleasant, and the waterfront is only blocks away for a great morning run/walk. Ask for a room with a view of the Bay Bridge so you can see the light show at night.< /text>< pictures>

< Text>
Every inch of this hotel is beautifully maintained and impeccable. The staff was nothing but gracious, kind and responsive throughout the hotel. The location is right in the center of the financial district and is accessible to all areas of the city and just a short distance from the nearest BART station. We stayed here with our toddler (which was obviously not the norm in the financial district) but were still treated as though we were right where we belonged. We stayed a week and it was one of our best vacations. We absolutely recommend this place hands down if it is within your budget.< /Text>

< text>
I never complain about hotels, and honestly this hotel was a nice place, but for over $400 a night, the issues I had with the internet were too much. I was there for 2.5 days and had a number of business calls. When I first arrived, i couldn't get online, and after the staff telling me for 4 hours that it was fine, someone finally told me internet service had been down for the entire hotel for a few hours with no timetable for return. They told me to go to Starbucks, which I did, and when I came back to check, someone else told me internet had been fine the whole time. When I couldn't log in again, a different person told me they were still having an issue, but would send someone to my room. That person never came, and I was never able to get on. Late night I came back one night and asked about internet, and again, the new staff had no clue and said it must be my computer, even though now multiple other staff members confirmed there were issues. Either way, I just wanted an answer, and options for a solution - which never happened. Horrible experience to be trying to log in for conference calls and having to go to Starbucks and never having a timetable for a solution. Honestly unacceptable for a hotel of this caliber, and for all of the travel that I do for work this was one of the most frustrating experiences I've had.<//text>

<text>When I travel on business to San Francisco, my hotel of choice is Le Meridien. This establishment has a "boutique" feel, and the staff is always friendly and welcoming.

One item worth noting: during my latest stay at Le Meridien, the bulb was not working in the magnifying mirror in the bathroom. < username>
LoveTravel11</username>
